Docs.summary: Provides classes to create peer-to-peer (P2P) connections with Wi-Fi Direct.

remarks.para: Provides classes to create peer-to-peer (P2P) connections with Wi-Fi Direct.

Using these APIs, you can discover and connect to other devices when each device supports Wi-Fi Direct, then communicate over a speedy connection across distances much longer than a Bluetooth connection. remarks.para:
Several other interfaces and classes are necessary as well, such as:
The interface allows you to receive callbacks when an operation such as discovering peers or connecting to them succeeds or fails.
interface allows you to receive information about discovered peers. The callback provides a , from which you can retrieve a object for each device within range and get information such as the device name, address, device type, the WPS configurations the device supports, and more.
The interface allows you to receive information about a P2P group. The callback provides a object, which provides group information such as the owner, the network name, and passphrase.
interface allows you to receive information about the current connection. The callback provides a object, which has information such as whether a group has been formed and who is the group owner.
